message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it proposes a novel framework for learning local image descriptors. It also uses a siamese architecture of Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) which is a common technique in computer vision. The paper also explores hyper-parameters and evaluates performance gains, which are common practices in computer vision research. 

The paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it uses a Hinge embedding loss and stochastic sampling, which are common techniques in machine learning. 

The paper may also be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as it proposes a new approach to learning image descriptors that could potentially improve the performance of computer vision systems. 

The paper may also be relevant to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category as it deals with image descriptors, which are commonly used in multimedia applications such as image retrieval and video analysis. 

Finally, the paper may be relevant to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it proposes a new approach to learning image descriptors that could potentially improve the performance of information retrieval systems that rely on image descriptors.
